verses.verse: The <S%H4853>burden<s%> of <S%H6865>Tyre<s%>. <S%H3213>Howl<s%>, ye <S%H591>ships<s%> of <S%H8659>Tarshish<s%>; for it is laid <S%H7703>waste<s%>, so that there is no <S%H1004>house<s%>, no entering <S%H935>in<s%>: from the <S%H776>land<s%> of <S%H3794>Chittim<s%> it is <S%H1540>revealed<s%> to them.

Be <S%H1826>still<s%>, ye <S%H3427>inhabitants<s%> of the <S%H339>isle<s%>; thou whom the <S%H5503>merchants<s%> of <S%H6721>Zidon<s%>, that pass <S%H5674>over<s%> the <S%H3220>sea<s%>, have <S%H4390>replenished<s%>. still: Heb. silent

And by <S%H7227>great<s%> <S%H4325>waters<s%> the <S%H2233>seed<s%> of <S%H7883>Sihor<s%>, the <S%H7105>harvest<s%> of the <S%H2975>river<s%>, is her <S%H8393>revenue<s%>; and she is a <S%H5505>mart<s%> of <S%H1471>nations<s%>.

Be thou <S%H954>ashamed<s%>, O <S%H6721>Zidon<s%>: for the <S%H3220>sea<s%> hath <S%H559>spoken<s%>, even the <S%H4581>strength<s%> of the <S%H3220>sea<s%>, <S%H559>saying<s%>, I <S%H2342>travail<s%> not, nor bring forth <S%H3205>children<s%>, neither do I nourish <S%H1431>up<s%> young <S%H970>men<s%>, nor bring <S%H7311>up<s%> <S%H1330>virgins<s%>.
As at the <S%H8088>report<s%> concerning <S%H4714>Egypt<s%>, so shall they be sorely <S%H2342>pained<s%> at the <S%H8088>report<s%> of <S%H6865>Tyre<s%>.
Pass ye <S%H5674>over<s%> to <S%H8659>Tarshish<s%>; <S%H3213>howl<s%>, ye <S%H3427>inhabitants<s%> of the <S%H339>isle<s%>.

Is this your <S%H5947>joyous<s%> city, whose <S%H6927>antiquity<s%> is of <S%H6924>ancient<s%> <S%H3117>days<s%>? her own <S%H7272>feet<s%> shall <S%H2986>carry<s%> her afar <S%H7350>off<s%> to <S%H1481>sojourn<s%>. afar: Heb. from afar off

Who hath taken this <S%H3289>counsel<s%> against <S%H6865>Tyre<s%>, the <S%H5849>crowning<s%> city, whose <S%H5503>merchants<s%> are <S%H8269>princes<s%>, whose <S%H3667>traffickers<s%> are the <S%H3513>honourable<s%> of the <S%H776>earth<s%>?

The <S%H3068>LORD<s%> of <S%H6635>hosts<s%> hath <S%H3289>purposed<s%> it, to <S%H2490>stain<s%> the <S%H1347>pride<s%> of all <S%H6643>glory<s%>, and to bring into <S%H7043>contempt<s%> all the <S%H3513>honourable<s%> of the <S%H776>earth<s%>. to stain: Heb. to pollute
<S%H5674>Pass<s%> through thy <S%H776>land<s%> as a <S%H2975>river<s%>, O <S%H1323>daughter<s%> of <S%H8659>Tarshish<s%>: there is no more <S%H4206>strength<s%>. strength: Heb. girdle

He stretched <S%H5186>out<s%> his <S%H3027>hand<s%> over the <S%H3220>sea<s%>, he <S%H7264>shook<s%> the <S%H4467>kingdoms<s%>: the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> hath given a <S%H6680>commandment<s%> against the <S%H3667>merchant<s%> city, to <S%H8045>destroy<s%> the <S%H4581>strong<s%> <S%H4581>holds<s%> thereof. against: or, concerning a merchantman the merchant city: Heb. Canaan strong: or, strengths

And he <S%H559>said<s%>, Thou shalt no <S%H3254>more<s%> <S%H5937>rejoice<s%>, O thou <S%H6231>oppressed<s%> <S%H1330>virgin<s%>, <S%H1323>daughter<s%> of <S%H6721>Zidon<s%>: <S%H6965>arise<s%>, pass <S%H5674>over<s%> to <S%H3794>Chittim<s%>; there also shalt thou have no <S%H5117>rest<s%>.

Behold the <S%H776>land<s%> of the <S%H3778>Chaldeans<s%>; this <S%H5971>people<s%> was not, till the <S%H804>Assyrian<s%> <S%H3245>founded<s%> it for them that dwell in the <S%H6728>wilderness<s%>: they set <S%H6965>up<s%> the <S%H971>towers<s%> thereof, they raised <S%H6209>up<s%> the <S%H759>palaces<s%> thereof; and he <S%H7760>brought<s%> it to <S%H4654>ruin<s%>.
<S%H3213>Howl<s%>, ye <S%H591>ships<s%> of <S%H8659>Tarshish<s%>: for your <S%H4581>strength<s%> is laid <S%H7703>waste<s%>.

And it shall come to pass in that <S%H3117>day<s%>, that <S%H6865>Tyre<s%> shall be <S%H7911>forgotten<s%> <S%H7657>seventy<s%> <S%H8141>years<s%>, according to the <S%H3117>days<s%> of <S%H259>one<s%> <S%H4428>king<s%>: after the <S%H7093>end<s%> of <S%H7657>seventy<s%> <S%H8141>years<s%> shall <S%H6865>Tyre<s%> <S%H7892>sing<s%> as an <S%H2181>harlot<s%>. shall Tyre: Heb. it shall be unto Tyre as the song of an harlot

<S%H3947>Take<s%> an <S%H3658>harp<s%>, go <S%H5437>about<s%> the <S%H5892>city<s%>, thou <S%H2181>harlot<s%> that hast been <S%H7911>forgotten<s%>; make <S%H3190>sweet<s%> <S%H5059>melody<s%>, sing <S%H7235>many<s%> <S%H7892>songs<s%>, that thou mayest be <S%H2142>remembered<s%>.

And it shall come to pass after the <S%H7093>end<s%> of <S%H7657>seventy<s%> <S%H8141>years<s%>, that the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> will <S%H6485>visit<s%> <S%H6865>Tyre<s%>, and she shall <S%H7725>turn<s%> to her <S%H868>hire<s%>, and shall commit <S%H2181>fornication<s%> with all the <S%H4467>kingdoms<s%> of the <S%H776>world<s%> upon the <S%H6440>face<s%> of the <S%H127>earth<s%>.

And her <S%H5504>merchandise<s%> and her <S%H868>hire<s%> shall be <S%H6944>holiness<s%> to the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>: it shall not be <S%H686>treasured<s%> nor laid <S%H2630>up<s%>; for her <S%H5504>merchandise<s%> shall be for them that <S%H3427>dwell<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, to <S%H398>eat<s%> <S%H7654>sufficiently<s%>, and for <S%H6266>durable<s%> <S%H4374>clothing<s%>. durable: Heb. old
